fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Taxation, Single market, Banking and financial services
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
membership: The UK All Party Parliamentary SME Group (Westminster)
goals__remit: The Genesis Initiative was established to enhance the level and quality of dialogue on SME policy development, both in the U.K. and across the EU. This objective is achieved through research, the drafting of policy papers, the issuing of a regular Manifesto on improved measures to assist SME growth, and by acting as an advocacy body in the common interests of small businesses, vis-à-vis the UK Government  ministries and members of the EU Parliament
relevant_communication:
Publication of Genesis Initiative SME Manifesto (launched at The Palace of Westminster, November 2014), with contributions from HRH Prince Michael of Kent, Members of the House of Commons, academics and SME policy experts. 
 
2017 SME Manifesto version in preparation. 
 
Study of supply chains and their impact on SMEs in the context of Brexit
